BEN MCBEAN

Defacing Churchill's statue insults our troops - keep calm & spark real change

Former Royal Marine Ben McBean nearly lost his life in Afghanistan, and says he objects to anyone of any colour defacing Winston Churchill’s statue. SHALLOW GRAVE

How chilling 'Babes in the Wood' murders saw paedo evade justice for decades

SUSAN Blatchford, 11, and 12-year-old Gary Hanlon went missing in 1970 after meeting up for a kickabout near their London homes. Fifty years ago this week, their badly decomposed bodies were found in Epping Forest, covered in leaves and twigs. However, their killer was not found for three decades in a haunting cold case.
